tags: so this ended up longer than expected
question: 47/48 and jon/ygritte?
answer:
world enough and time - ygrittebardots - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]

“He didn’t prepare me for this,” Jon says at last, and there’s no accusation in his voice, no trace of anger or disappointment, just the truth laid bare. “Robb was meant to lead, not me. It was never supposed to be me.”

After being named King in the North, Jon is having trouble sleeping, and Ygritte doesn’t appreciate waking up to a cold bed.

summary: Hello! I heard you were looking for jonmund prompts :) could you feel comfortable writing some good ol' hurt/comfort post Battle...
question: Hello! I heard you were looking for jonmund prompts :) could you feel comfortable writing some good ol' hurt/comfort post Battle of The Bastards? After all Jon did almost die in that stampede and I think there's nothing like concerned!Tormund taking care of his little crow! :D
answer:
Sorry it’s taken me so long to get round to this, I’ve been so swamped with work <3

————————————-

When Tormund found Jon after the Battle, he was shaking with rage, covered head to toe in mud and blood and shit. His eyes still held that wild look that Tormund had seen for the first time earlier that day when he had run into the little crow on the battlefield, but the fear from then had been replaced with pure rage. 

He had of course seen Jon go for the Bolton bastard, watched as he’d pounded his fists into the man’s smug face. He’d have been proud if he didn’t know the pain that Jon’s actions were coming from. 

Now Jon was stood in a daze, unsure what he was supposed to do, as everyone around him worked to clear up the carnage that had befallen his childhood home. Tormund marched over to him, gripping his arms tightly and nudging him to move. 

“Come on little crow, lets go and get you cleaned up.” he says, steering Jon towards the rooms a servant had told him they could use. 

Jon opened his mouth to protest, but Tormund spoke before he could get a word out.

“You’ve done enough for one day, they’ll be alright without you for an hour.” 

****

Without his armour on, his curls wet around his face, and his skin cleared of all the filth of the battle, Tormund thought Jon looked tiny. He was sat in the tub of warm water staring blankly ahead. 

“Jon?” Tormund asked softly, bringing a hand to cup his cheek, “Are you there, little crow?” 

Jon blinked, his eyes turning to actually look at Tormund for the first time since they’d come inside. He offered Jon a small sad smile. 

“There you are. How are you feeling?” His voices barely a whisper. 

Jon’s face scrunched up with emotion, and his eyes filled with tears. 

“I couldn’t…Rickon… he was so young. I tired Tormund, I tried so hard.” He rasped out before dissolving into sobs, burying his head in Tormund’s shoulder. 

Tormund held him close, stroking his hand through Jon’s damp hair soothingly. 

“It’s not your fault little crow, there was nothing you could do.” He pulled Jon away from his shoulder to look into his eyes, much to the younger man’s displeasure. 

“You did everything you could Jon, that Bolton fucker was mental, that entire battle was mental. You did amazingly to even survive. I’m so proud of you Jon, my pretty little crow.” He pulled Jon back into his arms, wrapping him up tightly and holding him close. Jon murmured something into Tormund’s neck.

“What was that sweet one?” 

Jon tilted his head slightly to allow his voice to carry, but didn’t budge from Tormund’s embrace. 

“I was so scared. Thank you for finding me.” He sniffled and nuzzled back into his spot. 

“It’s alright little crow, you don’t need to be scared anymore. I’ve got you Jon, I’ve got you” and he held him close for the rest of the night. 


————————————-

short and sweet, I hope it was okay <3

send me more jonmund prompts xxx

summary: I absolutely loved Arya killing the night king but I feel like it would have been cooler if it had been him and Jon fighting one...
body: I absolutely loved Arya killing the night king but I feel like it would have been cooler if it had been him and Jon fighting one on one and just as the night king is about to kill Bran and Jon Arya swoops in and they kill him together but not before he manages to hit her with a fatal blow and the entire army collapses as she and the night king do and then they cut to Daenerys holding Jorah and crying to Jon holding Arya crying and Sansa, Gendry, Davos, Tormund, the hound, and Brienne make it over there to find Jon and Bran and celebrate and they see Jon holding her body and crying with bran watching and they start to mourn her and just when they think all hope is lost Melissandre walks in and bran looks at her and says “what do we say to the god of death?” then she kneels over Arya and puts her hand on her and says “not today” and then the episode ends with Arya suddenly taking a sharp breath in and opening her eyes then it cuts to black, I don’t know I feel like that would have been cooler but maybe that’s just me

I hope you like it :))

tags: fic: strike hard and true crow (or i'll come back and haunt you)
i would love it if you guys read by bad wrong jonsa fic
summary: fic: strike hard and true, crow (or i’ll come back and haunt you)
title: fic: strike hard and true, crow (or i’ll come back and haunt you)
body:
Death has come to bend the knee.

chapter seven

The promise of a Lannister was sure as war, mercenarial.

But the promise of a Stark was like the promise of Winter, gold and men and death stepped aside for it, and it came sweeping over the world, absolute.

She rode back with him to Castle Black, he had not trusted her to sit in front of him, had not trusted the sweet scent of her hair. But she wound her arms around him, holding tight as though they were riding through a storm and not the last, rare and sun-drowned day of the year.

Her palm, his heart.

His dead heart, her Stark promise.

And Jon Snow, dead between them

chapter one - chapter seven

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
if i ever write this damn
summary: A Game of Thrones AU: The Kingmaker After Rhaegar takes Lyanna for a second wife, the realm seemes to be at peace. The Mad King...
caption:
A Game of Thrones AU: The Kingmaker

After Rhaegar takes Lyanna for a second wife, the realm seemes to be at peace. The Mad King is dead, Rhaegar is now in the most powerful seat in the land with Lord Tywin as his Hand. Death comes for Rhaegar after 18 peaceful years and then blood spills. Two faction rise, one from the North, the other from the South, the Blues and Reds. A civil war begins and Queen Rhaella tearfully watches her country torn apart by the people she once considered family.

Lord Tywin supports Queen Lyanna’s son, the Prince Jon, believing he is the rightful King. Lyanna makes her brother, Lord Eddard, Hand of the King. Her good-sister ensures the support of the Vale and Riverlands and so the bloodshed can begin.

Queen Elia, as the mother of the older son, knows her Aegon belongs on the Iron Throne. With Viserys being a Maester and no other men except for Jon left in the family, Elia wages war with her brother Doran for her son’s Hand. With Lord Robert Baratheon throwing in his support for them, and with the experienced Lord Baratheon as their military commander, they cannot lose this war. 

Watching the realm bleed, Rhaella refuses to watch as it all comes burning down. For she is the mother of three dragons,not two. Her daughter, Princess Daenerys, has risen dragons from stones and conquered Slaver’s Bay in mere weeks. Rhaella knows her child is the best choice for the Iron Throne and that she should inherit the crown. The girl has been raised by fire and blood and she refused to bow to anyone. Rhaella disregards the claim of her grandsons and calls upon her daughter to become Queen. 

But, what did Rhaegar write in his will? Who is the rightfull heir to the Iron Throne? Who is the Kingmaker?

Her daughter, Princess Daenerys, has risen dragons from stones and conquered Slaver’s Bay in mere weeks. Rhaella knows her child is the best choice for the Iron Throne and that she should inherit the crown. The girl has been raised by fire and blood and she refused to bow to anyone. Rhaella disregards the claim of her grandsons and calls upon her daughter to become Queen. 

But, what did Rhaegar write in his will? Who is the rightfull heir to the Iron Throne? Who is the Kingmaker?

trail.content_raw:
A Game of Thrones AU: The Kingmaker

After Rhaegar takes Lyanna for a second wife, the realm seemes to be at peace. The Mad King is dead, Rhaegar is now in the most powerful seat in the land with Lord Tywin as his Hand. Death comes for Rhaegar after 18 peaceful years and then blood spills. Two faction rise, one from the North, the other from the South, the Blues and Reds. A civil war begins and Queen Rhaella tearfully watches her country torn apart by the people she once considered family.

Lord Tywin supports Queen Lyanna’s son, the Prince Jon, believing he is the rightful King. Lyanna makes her brother, Lord Eddard, Hand of the King. Her good-sister ensures the support of the Vale and Riverlands and so the bloodshed can begin.

Queen Elia, as the mother of the older son, knows her Aegon belongs on the Iron Throne. With Viserys being a Maester and no other men except for Jon left in the family, Elia wages war with her brother Doran for her son’s Hand. With Lord Robert Baratheon throwing in his support for them, and with the experienced Lord Baratheon as their military commander, they cannot lose this war. 

Watching the realm bleed, Rhaella refuses to watch as it all comes burning down. For she is the mother of three dragons,not two. Her daughter, Princess Daenerys, has risen dragons from stones and conquered Slaver’s Bay in mere weeks. Rhaella knows her child is the best choice for the Iron Throne and that she should inherit the crown. The girl has been raised by fire and blood and she refused to bow to anyone. Rhaella disregards the claim of her grandsons and calls upon her daughter to become Queen. 

But, what did Rhaegar write in his will? Who is the rightfull heir to the Iron Throne? Who is the Kingmaker?
trail.content:
A Game of Thrones AU: The Kingmaker

After Rhaegar takes Lyanna for a second wife, the realm seemes to be at peace. The Mad King is dead, Rhaegar is now in the most powerful seat in the land with Lord Tywin as his Hand. Death comes for Rhaegar after 18 peaceful years and then blood spills. Two faction rise, one from the North, the other from the South, the Blues and Reds. A civil war begins and Queen Rhaella tearfully watches her country torn apart by the people she once considered family.

Lord Tywin supports Queen Lyanna’s son, the Prince Jon, believing he is the rightful King. Lyanna makes her brother, Lord Eddard, Hand of the King. Her good-sister ensures the support of the Vale and Riverlands and so the bloodshed can begin.

Queen Elia, as the mother of the older son, knows her Aegon belongs on the Iron Throne. With Viserys being a Maester and no other men except for Jon left in the family, Elia wages war with her brother Doran for her son’s Hand. With Lord Robert Baratheon throwing in his support for them, and with the experienced Lord Baratheon as their military commander, they cannot lose this war. 

Watching the realm bleed, Rhaella refuses to watch as it all comes burning down. For she is the mother of three dragons,not two. Her daughter, Princess Daenerys, has risen dragons from stones and conquered Slaver’s Bay in mere weeks. Rhaella knows her child is the best choice for the Iron Throne and that she should inherit the crown. The girl has been raised by fire and blood and she refused to bow to anyone. Rhaella disregards the claim of her grandsons and calls upon her daughter to become Queen. 

But, what did Rhaegar write in his will? Who is the rightfull heir to the Iron Throne? Who is the Kingmaker?

description:
Chapters: 13/?
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
Rating: Mature
Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death
Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen, Gilly (ASoIaF)/Samwell Tarly, Aegon VI Targaryen/Daenerys Targaryen
Characters: Jon Snow, Daenerys Targaryen, Aegon VI Targaryen, Tyrion Lannister, Davos Seaworth, Bran Stark, Yara Greyjoy, Kinvara (Game of Thrones), Daario Naharis, Bronn (ASoIaF), Podrick Payne, Brienne of Tarth, Gendry Waters
Additional Tags: Children, Post-Canon, Hurt/Comfort, Angst, Trauma, Intimacy, Original Character(s), Post-Canon Fix-It
Summary:

This is a post 8x06 fictional work that explores certain loose ends that weren’t tied. Daenerys is brought back to life. She’s a mother. Jon is on the other side of the continent. Back where they both started. It’s a slow burn story, but it won’t crawl (I promise).

summary: Remember how in S1 Benjen promised Jon he’d tell him about his mother?
body:
Remember how in S1 Benjen promised Jon he’d tell him about his mother?

If only they’d had TIME for him to convey that key piece of info to Jon when he next saw him, in S7. I know there was a lot going on but … 🤷🏻‍♀️

summary:
Based on a prompt I saw where a villain kidnaps a hero’s sidekick when he sees how bad they treat them.
Sansa Stark, aka ‘Little...
body:
Based on a prompt I saw where a villain kidnaps a hero’s sidekick when he sees how bad they treat them.

  • Sansa Stark, aka ‘Little Bird’, is sidekick to the superhero Joffrey Baratheon, aka ‘Brightroar’, at first excited to work with a famed young hero Little Bird is enamoured, but after years of servitude and increasingly no hope of promotion paired with the bad treatment and realisation that Brightroar isn’t the hero the people think, makes Little Bird question all that she knows about heroes… and villains. In comes ‘Longclaw’, a mysterious figure causing a stir down south. He comes from the North, the same place as Little Bird, and he forces her to question if there really is good and evil, and do the heroes of her childhood stories, the heroic figures she thought she would find in the South really exist? Is Longclaw the villain everyone says, or is he really the hero of this story?

Do plan on maybe writing this but i’m travelling rn without a laptop so that will be difficult. But will try next weekend when i’m home.

body:
GoT hacks Shakespeare

Hack 2: when Jon Snow hacked Macbeth’s brain.

Three witches : Macbeth, you will be king.

Jon!Macbeth then gets the heck out of there, takes his horse and exiles himself from King Duncan’s kingdom.

Jon!Macbeth: I don’t want it!

THE END

summary: I really hate fics where ppl portray daenerys as a child who doesn't know anything about war/military strategy or worse, a...
body: I really hate fics where ppl portray daenerys as a child who doesn’t know anything about war/military strategy or worse, a spoiled brat who only knows how to demand things and throw tantrums (especially when that fic is based in canon like dany and a spoiled brat?? lmao what? where?) but they portray tyrion and Jon as these incredibly strategic guys who don’t take a single breath if it won’t benefit the war or the realm in some way

summary: Til Death Do Us Part... - Wedding Day 20 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/gD5I3fjRMX  Ilva the Winter had always imagined her...
caption:
Til Death Do Us Part… - Wedding Day 20 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/gD5I3fjRMX 

Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding day to be the most beautiful day of her life. And even though she loves Jon Snow more than anything else in the world, she can’t help missing the man she had planned this wedding with. But Robb Stark died on a battlefield far away from home and Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her now. Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her and Jon now. 

*A modern Game of Thrones fanfiction with a female OC describing the wedding day and Ilva’s life with Robb and with Jon*

summary: How Jon’s justifying of Daenerys could make sense
title: How Jon’s justifying of Daenerys could make sense
body:
It goes completely against Jon’s character to try to justify what happened in KL. I have a theory that is no dumber than anything else in this show.

  • Varys, for an unforeseen reason, arranged for Jon to be given hallucinogenic drugs in the case that he was executed.
  • Jon had a vivid hallucination that something different happened.
  • Not the events of The Bells. But likely something involving frat parties, Shaggydog’s ghost, and neon lighting.
  • The details are up to you.
  • Jon thought the one guy he killed was the Night King, and he was upset about not being given a proper fight with him. 
  • The drugs wore off at the start of Episode 6.
  • Arya needed to specify that Dany was a killer because Jon thought she’d just been killing it on the dance floor.
  • He couldn’t understand why she would do this, and literally needed Tyrion to spell it out, because he did not want to admit that he thought he was at a party the whole time, and suffered from FOMO (fear of missing out) due to missing out on the entire episode.

“It’s a stupid theory,” you may say. But go back and look at the episodes. And ask yourself these two things.

  1. Does it account for all of Jon’s confusion during Episode 6?
  2. Does it seem like something D&D would write?

  2. Does it seem like something D&D would write?

summary: Game of Thrones - Truth - Ramin Djawadi (Season 7) [official]  For the season 7 finale, Djawadi worked on something much more...
caption:
Game of Thrones - Truth - Ramin Djawadi (Season 7) [official]

For the season 7 finale, Djawadi worked on something much more subtle. Knowing that Jon Snow and Daenerys would eventually fall in love just as the series revealed Jon’s true parentage, Djawadi tried to hint at his final theme, “Truth,” that would play during the pivotal finale scene.

“I was so hush-hush about it because I didn’t want people paying attention to the scene even more, but the first time we hear a little bit of [‘Truth’] is in episode 3, when Daenerys gives Jon permission to mine the dragonglass,” he tells EW. “That’s something we planted in the beginning. The next time we hear it is when they go into the cave… It develops slowly over that episode, but it’s fully played in that scene Sunday night.”

Musically, Djawadi didn’t rely on his previous themes for the Starks and Targaryens. (The former plays over Winterfell scenes, the latter has capped several season finales in support of Daenerys.) Instead, he tried to add some mystery to his score. “It’s supposed to be its own thing,” Djawadi explains. “The trick with this theme is that it really had to be a love theme but when we played it in earlier episodes, you don’t want to give away the love too soon. So it had to be a theme that could be a little bit mysterious, a little moody, and you could play it darker at times. I know everybody was expecting [them to get together] but we really had to be able to do this slowly. That was the most important thing for me.”

Game of Thrones composer breaks down season 7 finale score
